Common causes of fever include viral infections, bacterial infections, inflammatory conditions, autoimmune disorders, certain medications, and vaccinations.
Some common symptoms of a fever include elevated body temperature, chills and shivering, sweating, headache, muscle aches, fatigue, and loss of appetite.
A fever is usually diagnosed by looking at symptoms, medical history, and a physical check-up. Tests like blood tests or imaging may also be done.
Treatment for a fever usually involves rest and hydration, as well as over-the-counter pain relievers to reduce symptoms.
A fever is a sign that the body is fighting an illness. It's a temporary rise in temperature.Fevers are usually a sign that the body is fighting an infection.
A cough is a common symptom that helps to clear your airways of mucus, phlegm, or irritants. Coughs can be either dry or wet.
Try taking a steamy shower to help relieve your cough
You should try drinking some warm liquids like tea or broth
try honey or lemon in hot water.
A dry cough is usually caused by a viral illness, such as the common cold, and doesn't produce mucus or phlegm. A wet cough produces mucus or phlegm.
If you have a persistent cough that lasts more than a week, it's a good idea to see a doctor to find out what's causing it and get appropriate treatment.
Drinking plenty of fluids and avoiding irritants, such as smoke and strong odors, can help to relieve coughing symptoms.
You can try drinking plenty of fluids
You can try drinking gargle with salt water and avoid irritants such as smoke and strong odors.
Soothing teas, such as chamomile or licorice root tea, can also help relieve a sore throat.
you can try drinkinng Honey and lemon in warm water can also be soothing.
Steaming your face with a bowl of hot water and a towel can also help to relieve sore throat symptoms.
Always consult your doctor before trying any home remedies, especially if you have any underlying health conditions.
